title: Nationwide to hand £2m back to customers in PPI gaffe
text:
Nationwide neglected to remind borrowers between 2012 and 2016 that they were paying for payment protection insurance

Nationwide has been forced to hand £2million back to customers for failing to remind them they had taken out PPI, and how much they had paid for their policies.

The Competition and Markets Authority revealed yesterday that the building society had neglected to remind thousands of borrowers between 2012 and 2016 that they were paying for payment protection insurance.

It also sent inaccurate reminders between 2012 and 2019 which may have misled customers into thinking their policy was cheaper than it was.

More than 7,000 customers were affected, although Nationwide has already repaid around £100,000 in total to those who did not receive reminders.

The CMA's Adam Land said: 'Such breaches are serious and, if we had the extra powers, could have resulted in fines.'

The PPI mis-selling scandal is one of the biggest to rock the financial services industry.
